item.title: My Brother-in-Law Can’t Care for Himself. Do His Siblings Have to Bail Him Out?
item.description: He rarely communicates with the family, except when he’s in trouble.

item.title: When Dementia Steals the Imagination of a Children’s Book Writer
item.description: Robert Munsch wrote “The Paper Bag Princess,” “Love You Forever” and other classics by performing them over and over for kids. But his stories are slipping away.

item.title: Late-Night TV Is Fading. There’s One Part You May Come to Miss.
item.description: Most of what late-night talk shows offer has been supplanted by the internet — except for the role of the wry, dispassionate host.

item.title: Six World Leaders on Navigating Climate Change, Without the U.S.
item.description: We asked heads of state how they’re steering their countries as America retreats.

item.title: Muhammad Yunus, Chief Adviser of Bangladesh, on Getting Squeezed by Rising Tides
item.description: We asked heads of state how they’re steering their countries as America retreats.

item.title: President William Ruto of Kenya on Pushing Clean Energy Amid Domestic Unrest
item.description: We asked heads of state how they’re steering their countries as America retreats.

item.title: Hilda Heine, President of the Marshall Islands, on Leading a Sinking Country
item.description: We asked heads of state how they’re steering their countries as America retreats.

item.title: Anthony Albanese, Prime Minister of Australia, on Getting Past Climate Partisanship
item.description: We asked heads of state how they’re steering their countries as America retreats.

item.title: Irfaan Ali, President of Guyana, on Putting Oil Profits Into Clean Energy

item.title: Finnish Prime Minister Petteri Orpo on Winning the Debate on Climate Change
item.description: We asked heads of state how they’re steering their countries as America retreats.

item.title: Should I Watch a TV Show Recommended by My Robot Vacuum?
item.description: A ruling on an unusual source of viewing advice.

item.title: With the Em Dash, A.I. Embraces a Fading Tradition
item.description: The debate about ChatGPT’s use of the em dash signifies a shift in not only how we write, but what writing is for.

item.title: What Will China’s Green-Tech Ambitions Cost the World?
item.description: Laos is just one of the emerging markets where China’s green-tech revolution is installing more than cheap energy.

item.title: Political Violence Isn’t New. But Something About This Moment Is.
item.description: Charlie Kirk’s assassination fits into American history. How does it fit into our politics?
